intro: Euphrasia retroticha, commonly known as the yellow evening-primrose, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes several parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant produces small, yellow, tubular flowers that bloom in the late afternoon and evening. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia retroticha is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sunny to partially shaded environments.
